00019             class T2, 
00020             class T3,
00021             class T4,
00022             class T5,
00023             class T6
00024         >
00025 struct tuple_base
00026 {
00027   typedef T1 first_type;
00028   typedef T2 second_type;
00029   typedef T3 third_type;
00030   typedef T4 fourth_type;
00031   typedef T5 fifth_type;
00032   typedef T6 sixth_type;
00033   
00034   template <int I>
00035   struct item_type
00036   {/*

00038                                 CASE<2,second_type,

00040                                 CASE<4,fourth_type,
00041                                 CASE<5,fifth_type,
00042                                 CASE<6,sixth_type,
00043                                 CASE<DEFAULT,void 
00044                             > > > > > > > >::result result;*/
00045   };

00052 template <  class T1,
00053             class T2 = Plug, 
00054             class T3 = Plug,
00055             class T4 = Plug,
00056             class T5 = Plug,
00057             class T6 = Plug
00058         >
00059 struct tuple
00060 {
00061   typedef T1 first_type;
00062   typedef T2 second_type;
00063   typedef T3 third_type;
00064   typedef T4 fourth_type;
00065   typedef T5 fifth_type;
00066   typedef T6 sixth_type;
00067   
00068   template <int I>
00069   struct item_type
00070   {
00071     typedef typename SWITCH<I,  CASE<1,first_type,
00072                                 CASE<2,second_type,
00073                                 CASE<3,third_type,
00074                                 CASE<4,fourth_type,
00075                                 CASE<5,fifth_type,
00076                                 CASE<6,sixth_type,
00077                                 CASE<DEFAULT,void 
00078                             > > > > > > > >::result result;
00079   };
00080   
00082   first_type first;
00084   second_type second;
00086   third_type third;
00088   fourth_type fourth;
00090   fifth_type fifth;
00092   sixth_type sixth;
00093   
00094   tuple(){}
00095   tuple(  first_type fir,
00096           second_type sec,
00097           third_type thi,
00098           fourth_type fou,
00099           fifth_type fif,
00100           sixth_type six
00101         ):
00102     first(fir),
00103     second(sec),
00104     third(thi),
00105     fourth(fou),
00106     fifth(fif),
00107     sixth(six)
00108   {}
00109 };
00110 
00112 template <class T1>
00113 struct tuple<T1,Plug,Plug,Plug,Plug>
00114 {
00115   typedef T1 first_type;
00116   
00117   first_type first;
00118   
00119   template <int I>
00120   struct item_type
00121   {
00122      typedef typename IF<I==1,first_type,void>::result result;
00123   };
00124   
00125   tuple(){}
00126   tuple(first_type fi):
00127     first(fi)
00128   {}
00129 };
00130 
00132 template <class T1,class T2>
00133 struct tuple<T1,T2,Plug,Plug,Plug,Plug>
00134 {
00135   typedef T1 first_type;
00136   typedef T2 second_type;
00137   
00138   template <int I>
00139   struct item_type
00140   {
00141     typedef typename SWITCH<I,  CASE<1,first_type,
00142                                 CASE<2,second_type,
00143                                 CASE<DEFAULT,void >
00144                              > > >::result result;
00145   };
00146   
00147   first_type first;
00148   second_type second;
00149   
00150   tuple(){}
00151   tuple(  first_type fi,
00152           second_type se
00153         ):
00154     first(fi),
00155     second(se)
00156   {}
00157     
00158 };
